title: Forbes 30 Under 30: Ritvik Sharma Shares His Success Mantras

content.text: Recognized by Forbes in their prestigious 30 Under 30 list, Ritvik Sharma, the force behind Velvét, speaks about building a multi-million dollar luxury fashion empire before turning 30. From a small studio in New Delhi to commanding international runways, Sharma’s rise offers invaluable insights for aspiring entrepreneurs worldwide.

In his conversation with Forbes, Sharma attributes his success to an unwavering commitment to structured routines and laser-sharp focus. 'I wake up at 5:30 AM every day, meditate, and dedicate my mornings to creative design work — no emails, no distractions,' he reveals. For him, discipline doesn’t stifle creativity; it amplifies it.

Sharma emphasizes that sustainable scaling — balancing growth with quality — is key. 'I didn’t chase rapid expansion. I focused on building processes that could support luxury at scale,' he explains. Today, Velvét operates across three continents while maintaining handcrafted excellence.

He encourages young founders worldwide: 'Stay original, stay relentless — that's how legends are made.' His mantra resonates across Velvét’s journey, from breaking into Paris Fashion Week to dressing global icons like Priyanka Chopra and Harry Styles.

Behind the success, Sharma candidly shares the failures that shaped him. Early supplier disputes, production delays, and financial crunches tested his resilience. 'Every setback was a tuition fee for the next stage,' he laughs. This grit, combined with adaptability, propelled Velvét from local label to global phenomenon.

When COVID-19 disrupted fashion weeks and supply chains, Sharma pivoted swiftly to digital shows and virtual client fittings, maintaining momentum while competitors stalled. 'Agility is survival in today’s luxury landscape,' he advises fellow entrepreneurs.

As he looks ahead, Sharma is focused on building Velvét into a legacy brand that stands for modern Indian luxury. Plans are underway to launch an academy supporting young designers and artisans, nurturing the next generation of fashion talent from India.

His upcoming collaboration with Forbes aims to spotlight other under-30 changemakers from emerging markets, amplifying voices often overlooked on global platforms. 'It’s not just about my journey. It’s about creating ladders for others to climb,' Sharma concludes.
For young readers inspired by his rise, Sharma leaves a final word of wisdom: 'Dream global, but execute local. Excellence is born when vision meets discipline.'
